IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE PEDDIE COMMUNITY COMMITS ITSELF to the intellectual, social, and moral growth of our students. WE challenge our students to reach for levels of achievement (See Sch O)
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE PEDDIE COMMUNITY COMMITS ITSELF TO THE INTELLECTUAL, SOCIAL, AND MORAL GROWTH OF OUR STUDENTS. WE CHALLENGE OUR STUDENTS TO REACH FOR LEVELS OF ACHIEVEMENT THEY HAVE NOT ATTEMPTED BEFORE AND ENCOURAGE THEM TO MEASURE THE SUCCESS OF THEIR EFFORTS BY THE PROGRESS THEY MAKE. ULTIMATELY, WE SEEK NOT ONLY TO PROVIDE OUR STUDENTS WITH VIGOROUS PREPARATION FOR COLLEGE BUT ALSO TO INSPIRE THEM TO STRIVE FOR THE HIGHEST QUALITY OF CITIZENSHIP.
IRS990.Desc: A PRIVATE SECONDARY BOARDING/DAY SCHOOL ENROLLING 542 STUDENTS IN GRADES 9-12 AND POST GRADUATE DURING THE SCHOOL YEAR, AND ACADEMIC COURSES FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES 5 - 12 DURING THE SUMMER. EXPENSES INCLUDE FINANCIAL AID OF $8,118,831.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL HOLDS TWO WETLANDS EASEMENTS AS PART OF ITS CAMPUS LAND. THIS IS ACCOUNTED FOR AS A PART OF LAND AMOUNT ON THE SCHOOL'S BALANCE SHEET.

INCLUDED IN THIS COLLECTION ARE SUCH NOTABLE BOOKS AS CHARLES DARWIN'S ON THE ORIGIN OF SPECIES ($15,000), HARTMAN SCHEDEL'S NURENBERG CHRONICLE ($35,000), AND THE LATIN BOOK OF HOURS OF THE VIRGIN ($25,00O). ADDITIONALLY, THERE ARE BOOKS BY THOMAS JEFFERSON, JOHN KEATS AND G. CHAUCER. THESE BOOKS AND MANUSCRIPTS PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR OUR STUDENTS TO GAIN INVALUABLE INSIGHT AS TO HISTORICAL PERSPECTIVES AND A CHANCE TO VIEW CLASSICAL LITERATURE IN THEIR ORIGINAL FORM THAT THEY COULD NOT OTHERWISE EVER SEE. ADDITIONALLY, THE SCHOOL POSSESSES A L'ARBRE SCULPTURE THAT IS ON DISPLAY IN THE SCHOOL'S ART CENTER FOR THE VIEWING PLEASURE OF THE ART STUDENTS AND TO THE PUBLIC AT EXHIBITIONS.

THE PEDDIE SCHOOL ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE DONOR RESTRICTED AND PRIMARILY PROVIDE FOR FINANCIAL AID TO PEDDIE'S STUDENTS AND SUPPORT FOR THE SCHOOL'S GENERAL OPERATIONS. ENDOWMENT INCOME ALSO PROVIDES SUPPORT FOR THE SCHOOL'S FACULTY SALARIES AS WELL AS ACADEMIC PROGRAMS, FIELD TRIPS FOR STUDENTS, AND GENERAL USE.

"ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES' CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ENTITY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE SCHOOL AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2016 AND 2015, THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE THE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY OR DISCLOSURE IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE SCHOOL RECOGNIZES ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, IF ANY. THERE WERE NO INCOME TAX-RELATED INTEREST OR PENALTIES RECORDED FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016 AND 2015.

A STATEMENT OF PEDDIE'S NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY IS INCLUDED IN ALL BROCHURES AND CATALOGS THAT PERTAIN TO STUDENT ADMISSIONS PROGRAMS AND SCHOLARSHIPS. PEDDIE ALSO PUBLISHES AN ANNUAL PRINT ADVERTISEMENT THROUGH NAIS (NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: THE BALANCE OF THE TAX-EXEMPT BONDS SHOWN ON THE PART X, LINE 20 THAT
ARE NOT INCLUDED ON SCHEDULE K WERE ISSUED BEFORE 2003.
THE REBATE COMPUTATION WAS PERFORMED ON APRIL 1, 2009.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONE OF THE MANAGING MEMBERS OF YORKTOWN PARTNERS SERVES AS AN INVESTMENT MANAGER AND WAS A MEMBER OF THE SCHOOL'S INVESTMENT COMMITTEE. ONE OF THE PRINCIPALS OF STUDIOHILLIER, LLC IS A MEMBER OF THE SCHOOL'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. STUDIOHILLER, LLC WAS ENGAGED TO DESIGN TWO DORMITORIES. THE SON OF DR. JOHN DRSTVENSEK, DIRECTOR OF THE HENSLE HEALTH CENTER AT PEDDIE SCHOOL, IS A MEMBER OF THE SCHOOL'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE AMOUNT REPORTED IN PART IV OF SCHEDULE L IS BASED ON THE SCHOOL'S FISCAL YEAR. FORM 990, PART VII IS BASED UPON CALENDAR YEAR WAGES AND DR. JOHN DRSTVENSEK'S CALENDAR YEAR WAGES WERE BELOW THE REPORTING THRESHOLD FOR THAT PART AND THEREFORE, HE IS NOT INCLUDED ON FORM 990, PART VII.
USE THIRD PARTIES THE SCHOOL USED THEIR INVESTMENT BROKERS TO SELL THEIR CONTRIBUTED MARKETABLE SECURITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The audit committee of the Peddie School's board of trustees is given a presentation of the 990 and 990t and meets to review the returns before the returns are filed. A copy of the peddie school's 990 and 990T are also made available to the entire board of trustees with an opportunity to raise any questions or concerns.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A conflict of interest questionnaire and statement is completed by the entire board of trustees on an annual basis. The statements are kept on file and reviewed by the Audit Committee. The Board of Trustees is responsible for resolving matters that arise.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Annually, the executive committee of the peddie board of trustees conducts a review of compensation for officers and key employees. the committee reviews employee performance evaluations, historical salary, listing of all benefits and a comparison study of salary and benefits for similar positions at comparable schools.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The peddie school does not make its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements available to the public. the financial statements are made available to bondholders, insurers, rating agencies and others with a financial interest.
CHANGE IN INTEREST RATE SWAPS 335,497 CHANGE IN SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS 225,273 WRITE-OFF OF UNCOLLECTIBLE PLEDGES 64,558 TOTAL 625,328
THE REVIEW PROCESS FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
THE GAIN SHOWN IS NET OF $1,430,444 IN INVESTMENT EXPENSES.

(CONTINUATION FROM FORM 990, PART I, LINE 1) they have not attempted before and encourage them to measure the success of their efforts by the progress they make. Ultimately, we seek not only to provide our students with vigorous preparation for college but also to inspire them to strive for the highest quality of citizenship.
THE FINANICAL AID SHOWN ON PART IX, LINE 2 INCLUDES $1,299,200 IN TUITION REMISSION FOR CHILDREN OF EMPLOYEES OF PEDDIE SCHOOL.
